title: Erigon currently stops syncing, but no errors are reported
body:
#### System information

Erigon version：erigon version 2.43.0-stable

OS & Version：Linux - Ubuntu 22.10

Commit hash: 

Erigon Command (with flags/config)：
--datadir=/node2/data-erigon
--torrent.download.rate=20mb 
--http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 
--authrpc.jwtsecret /node2/data-erigon/jwt.hex


Concensus Layer：Prysm v4.0.5

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
--datadir=/node2/data-prysm 
--jwt-secret=/node2/data-erigon/jwt.hex 
--rpc-host=0.0.0.0 
--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0 
--monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 -
-execution-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8551 
--accept-terms-of-use=true


Chain/Network: 

Expected behaviour
Erigon data is continuously synchronized, and the mdbx.data file in the chaindata directory should continue to grow.

Actual behaviour
Erigon currently stops syncing, but no errors are reported.The capacity of the mdbx.data file in chaindata is 1486058684416 bytes, which has not changed for two days.

Steps to reproduce the behaviour
erigon does not currently have continuous sync data，but no errors are reported.

diagnostic info 1：logs info
[INFO] [06-23|16:25:30.126] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=2.6GB sys=3.1GB
[INFO] [06-23|16:26:30.121] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=2.3GB sys=3.1GB

[INFO] [06-23|16:31:30.126] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=2.8GB sys=3.1GB

- let's try to upgrade erigon? 
- also can provide next info: `curl -sK -v http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/goroutine?debug=1 > goroutines.txt`
- what is prysm version?

Thanks for your answer！
1.My prysm version is：V 4.0.5
2.The Command：curl -sK -v http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/goroutine?debug=1 > goroutines.txt

curl: option -sK: error encountered when reading a file
curl: try 'curl --help' or 'curl --manual' for more information

3.How to upgrade while erigon is running？

Maybe unrelated, but mumbai on 2.47 doesn't keep up and keeps thinking it's synced when it's is in fact not. The node in the blue line shows synced rn but you can see it's fallen behind again and again
![image](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/assets/57159226/82739b56-51b0-428b-b2d7-b64e65374d28)
@icculp hi. your comment is not related to this issue. please create another issue with logs, hardware info, disk type, etc...

I use this command：curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_blockNumber","params":[],"id":1}' http://127.0.0.1:8545
Get the current latest synchronized block height：0xfbc51f（blockno：16499999）and stop syncing。

And after I upgrade erigon version from 2.43.0 to 2.47.0, the capacity of the mdbx.data file in chaindata is changed from1486058684416 bytes to 1484386635776 bytes。On the contrary, it has become less。

I don't know what to do now

Is this correct?

And then...

Hi. Did your issue get solved? @zlxadata 
I am having the similar problem after staged sync finished.
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
